content: textured fingerless gloves crochet pattern by carolanne creations abbreviations pattern uses us terminology single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch chain chain blo back loop only flo front loop only join slip_stitch to the first stitch of the round skip the slip_stitch and chain/s of the previous round decrease decrease crochet 2 stitches together lp lemon peel stitch this stitch is 1sc 1dc repeated to the end of the round the important part to create the lovely texture is to make sure that every single_crochet in done in a double_crochet stitch from the previous round and every double_crochet is done in a single_crochet from the previous round when starting a new round always chain 1 before doing a single_crochet and ch2 before doing a double_crochet these chains are not counted and the first stitch of the round is always into the same stitch as the chain materials 8 ply dk yarn approx 80-100g per pair most acrylic dk yarns will be fine i used approx 200mtrs of bendigo woollen mills stellar yarn 50/50 bamboo/wool 3 5 mm hook tapestry needle for weaving in ends stitch marker scissors gauge 20sts x 18 rounds = 10cm x 10cm approx over lp stitch size medium/large glove length 20cm width across mid palm of the hand 11cm this larger size is in brackets e g 16 small/medium glove length 17cm width across mid palm 10cm notes  except for the band the glove is worked in the round with a slip_stitch to join at the end of every round  the chain1 or chain 2 at the beginning of every round is not counted as a stitch  do not work into the chains or slip_stitch at the join always skip them  always work into the same stitch as the chain/chs at the beginning of every round sizing hands are different sizes and shapes this pattern can be easily adjusted for length of band thumb and main hand section by crocheting less or more row/rounds there are 2 sizes which mostly adjust the width of the glove and some length if you want the band to be bigger you can add some row but make sure to still pick up the correct number of stitches in the pattern e g if you do 4 extra row then pick up 4 less stitches for the main part of the glove just skip the extra stitches evenly around the band you can reduce the width of the main part of the glove by picking up less stitches from the band as long as it is an even number e g band is 42 row pick up 38 stitches evenly around the band the thumb width seems to be suitable for all sizes alternatively hook size and yarn can change the size of the gloves pattern make 2 gloves the same band note the band is crocheted vertically and when finished stitches are picked up from one edge to start on the main part of the glove
